952. With the death of Turnus the Aeneid ends immediately. To some readers, the hero of the Poem is dead3 and very properly “the rest is silence.'' Roman readers would mark the death of Aeneas' rival, whether hero or villain3 and thence-

forward the path of Aeneas would be straight, and therefore dramatically uninteresting.
